intro: Leontopodium javanicum, commonly known as the Java edelweiss, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Java and Sumatra. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and showy white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its unique appearance and habitat make it a rare and ecologically significant species. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is often considered a vulnerable plant.
